title: Grand Canyon Track
cardDescription: Explore sandstone cliffs, lush ferns, and waterfalls on this adventurous 6km loop through Blackheath’s Grand Canyon in the Blue Mountains.
imageAlt: Waterfall cascading over rocky ledges surrounded by dense forest along the Grand Canyon Track in Blackheath
overview: The Grand Canyon Track is a stunning 6km loop in the Blue Mountains, perfect for adventurous hikers looking to immerse themselves in a world of sandstone walls, cool-temperate rainforests, and cascading waterfalls. First established in 1907, this historic trail weaves through lush native vegetation. Though rated as a 'hard' walk due to a steep ascent at the end, it’s accessible without specialist equipment, making it great for well-prepared beginners and seasoned hikers alike.

content.content: Grand Canyon Track starts from the Grand Canyon carpark. You can get there by driving. Public transport is not available.

content: Exit from the Great Western Highway at Evans Lookout Road
Follow the signs to the Grand Canyon carpark

content.content: This walk is rated as moderate (Grade 3 in the Australian Walking Track Grading System). Moderate trails up to 20km, some rough areas and short, steep sections. Basic bushwalking experience helpful.

content: There are not rubbish bins in the area, please take all your rubbish with you.
Accessible toilets are available at the Grand Canyon carpark

content.content: This walk is not wheelchair-friendly. Assistance is needed due to steps and uneven terrain.
There are currently no alerts for this walk. Keep an eye on the Blue Haze social channels for updates.

content: Pets (not including registered assistance animals) are not permitted on this walk.
Smoking is not permitted on this walk or any other walk in the Blue Mountains National Park.
